events.originalText: The World Health Organization declared the COVID-19 pandemic to be a public health emergency of international concern.
events.subtitle: World Health Organization
events.headline: WHO declares COVID-19 pandemic a global health emergency

events.originalText: The Korea Aerospace Research Institute launched Naro-1, South Korea's first carrier rocket and their first launch vehicle to achieve Earth orbit.
events.subtitle: Korea Aerospace Research Institute
events.headline: Korea Aerospace Research Institute launches Naro-1 carrier rocket into Earth orbit

events.originalText: Kenya Airways Flight 431 crashed into the Atlantic Ocean near Ivory Coast shortly after takeoff, killing 169 on board.
events.subtitle: Kenya Airways Flight 431
events.headline: Kenya Airways Flight 431 crashes into Atlantic Ocean, 169 killed

events.originalText: Varig Flight 967 disappeared shortly after takeoff from Tokyo's Narita International Airport en route to Rio de Janeiro.
events.subtitle: Varig Flight 967
events.headline: Varig Flight 967 disappears after takeoff from Tokyo's Narita International Airport

events.originalText: The Troubles: On Bloody Sunday, members of the British Parachute Regiment shot 26 civil-rights protesters in Derry, Northern Ireland, killing at least 13 people.
events.subtitle: The Troubles
events.headline: Bloody Sunday: British Parachute Regiment shoots 26 protesters in Derry, Northern Ireland

events.originalText: Vietnam War: Forces of the Viet Cong and the Vietnamese People's Army launched the Tet Offensive to strike military and civilian command and control centers throughout South Vietnam.
events.subtitle: Vietnam War
events.headline: Viet Cong and Vietnamese People's Army launch Tet Offensive in South Vietnam

events.originalText: In a bloodless coup, Nguyễn Khánh overthrew Dương Văn Minh's military junta in South Vietnam, less than three months after Minh executed a bloody coup himself.
events.subtitle: Nguyễn Khánh
events.headline: Nguyễn Khánh overthrows Dương Văn Minh's military junta in South Vietnam

events.originalText: Nathuram Godse fatally shot Mahatma Gandhi, the political and spiritual leader of India and the Indian independence movement, at Birla House in Delhi.
events.subtitle: Nathuram Godse
events.headline: Nathuram Godse fatally shoots Mahatma Gandhi in Delhi

events.originalText: World War II: Allied forces liberated more than 500 prisoners of war (pictured) from a Japanese POW camp near Cabanatuan in the Philippines.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Allied forces liberate 500+ POWs from Japanese camp in the Philippines

events.originalText: In a speech to the Reichstag, Adolf Hitler threatened the "annihilation of the Jewish race in Europe".
events.subtitle: 30 January 1939 Reichstag speech
events.headline: Adolf Hitler threatens annihilation of Jewish race in Europe

events.originalText: Richard Lawrence became the first person to attempt to assassinate a sitting US president when he failed to kill Andrew Jackson at the US Capitol (assassination attempt pictured) and was subdued by the crowd.
events.subtitle: Richard Lawrence (failed assassin)
events.headline: Richard Lawrence fails to assassinate Andrew Jackson at US Capitol

events.originalText: Two years after his death, Oliver Cromwell's remains were exhumed for a posthumous execution and his head was placed on a spike above Westminster Hall in London, where it remained until 1685.
events.subtitle: Oliver Cromwell
events.headline: Oliver Cromwell's remains exhumed for posthumous execution

events.originalText: King Charles I, who was defeated in both the First and the Second English Civil Wars, was beheaded for high treason in front of the Banqueting House in London.
events.subtitle: Charles I of England
events.headline: King Charles I beheaded for high treason in London

events.originalText: Low-lying places around the coasts of the Bristol Channel of Britain were flooded, resulting in an estimated 2,000 deaths.
events.subtitle: Bristol Channel
events.headline: Floods in Bristol Channel area of Britain result in 2,000 deaths

events.originalText: Wareru created the Hanthawaddy Kingdom in today's Lower Burma and declared himself king following the collapse of the Pagan Empire.
events.subtitle: Wareru
events.headline: Wareru establishes Hanthawaddy Kingdom in Lower Burma

events.originalText: The German–Polish War ended with the signing of the Peace of Bautzen between Henry II, Holy Roman Emperor, and Bolesław I, the Piast ruler of Poland.
events.subtitle: List of wars between Germans and Poles
events.headline: Peace of Bautzen signed, ending German-Polish War
